title: Operating System Architecture
subject: Operating Systems
theory:
How the OS is built.
- **Monolithic**: Huge kernel, all services in one space. Fast but risky (one bug crashes all). (Linux/Unix).
- **Microkernel**: Minimal kernel, services in user space. Stable but slower due to messaging overhead. (Minix).

interview_questions.question: Why is Linux Monolithic?
interview_questions.answer: Performance. Function calls within kernel are faster than message passing between user modules.

summary: Big Kernel vs Small Kernel trade-off.
